skill.name: fiftyone-develop-plugin
skill.description: Develop custom FiftyOne plugins (operators and panels) from scratch. Use when user wants to create a new plugin, extend FiftyOne with custom operators, build interactive panels, or integrate external APIs into FiftyOne. Guides through requirements, design, coding, testing, and iteration.
skill.summary: Develop custom FiftyOne plugins (operators and panels) from scratch. Use when user wants to create a...
skill.author: AdonaiVera

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files that teach users how to develop FiftyOne plugins. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or code execution capabilities exist. All content is instructional documentation for plugin development best practices.

content.user_title: Create custom FiftyOne plugins for data visualization
content.value_statement: Users struggle to extend the FiftyOne computer vision platform with custom functionality. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building operators and panels that integrate seamlessly with the FiftyOne App.
actual_capabilities: Guide developers through plugin requirements gathering and planning
Generate Python operator code for data processing tasks
Create Python panel interfaces for interactive visualization
Build JavaScript React panels for rich user experiences
Define plugin manifests with operators, panels, and secrets configuration
Test and iterate plugin implementations in local FiftyOne environments
limitations: Does not install or modify FiftyOne plugins on user systems
Does not execute code or interact with FiftyOne datasets directly
Does not provide pre-built plugins - only teaches how to create them
Requires FiftyOne installation by the user for practical development

use_cases.title: Build custom data processors
use_cases.description: Create operators that transform datasets, run ML models, or export data in specialized formats

use_cases.title: Extend visualization capabilities
use_cases.description: Build panels that display custom metrics, interactive charts, or domain-specific visualizations

use_cases.title: Integrate external APIs
use_cases.description: Connect FiftyOne to external services for annotation, analysis, or data enrichment

prompt_templates.title: New plugin from scratch
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to create a new plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new FiftyOne plugin. I want to build a [operator/panel] that [describe functionality]. Walk me through the requirements gathering, design, and implementation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Python operator guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a Python operator in FiftyOne that [describe task]. Include the operator config, resolve_input, execute methods, and registration function.

prompt_templates.title: JavaScript panel template
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me build a JavaScript panel for FiftyOne using React. I need a panel that [describe UI functionality]. Show the component registration and state management.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin troubleshooting
prompt_templates.prompt: My FiftyOne plugin is not [appearing/working]. The plugin structure follows [describe structure]. Help me troubleshoot and fix the issue.

output_examples.input: Help me create an operator that exports labels to COCO format
output: â€¢ Create fiftyone.yml with operator listing
â€¢ Build ExportCOCO operator class with resolve_input for field selection
â€¢ Implement execute method with generator for progress updates
â€¢ Add resolve_output to display export results

best_practices: Always gather requirements before coding - clarify inputs, outputs, and external dependencies
Search existing plugins for patterns before implementing new functionality
Test plugins locally with small datasets before deploying to production
Follow naming conventions: @org/plugin-name for plugins, snake_case for operators and panels
anti_patterns: Skipping requirements gathering and assuming what the plugin should do
Not testing plugins in the FiftyOne App before considering them complete
Hardcoding secrets in source code instead of using the secrets configuration
Modifying files directly in site-packages instead of using the plugins directory

faq.question: What versions of FiftyOne are supported?
faq.answer: Plugins require FiftyOne 0.22 or later. Specify the minimum version in fiftyone.yml under the fiftyone.version field.

faq.question: What is the difference between operators and panels?
faq.answer: Operators perform actions (data processing, exports). Panels display interactive UIs alongside the sample grid in the FiftyOne App.

faq.question: Can I use external Python packages in my plugin?
faq.answer: Yes. List dependencies in requirements.txt. For JavaScript panels, define dependencies in package.json.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using community plugins?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. When installing plugins, review code and only install from trusted sources.

faq.question: Why is my plugin not appearing in the App?
faq.answer: Check that fiftyone.yml exists in the plugin root, verify location is ~/.fiftyone/plugins/, and restart the App after installation.

faq.question: How does this compare to FiftyOne Teams plugins?
faq.answer: This skill covers standard plugin development. FiftyOne Teams adds enterprise features like remote execution and team sharing.
